title: Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area: Park Home
body: A Jewel in Northeast Washington  In 1941 the Grand Coulee Dam was built on the Columbia River as part of the Columbia River Basin project, creating a 130-mile long lake. Named for President Franklin D. Roosevelt, Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area provides opportunities for boating, fishing, swimming, camping, canoeing, hunting and visiting historic Fort Spokane and St. Paul's Mission.              Plan Your Visit   Things to do and see while you explore the park!            Camping   Come enjoy the great outdoors with us!         Boating   All of our information about boating can be found here!              Fishing Around!   Come fish with us all throughout Lake Roosevelt!        Historical Sites   Take a walk through history with us!        Hunting Around the Park   All information about Hunting in the park can be found here.
